title: Quadratic Curves Quiz
description: Test your understanding of conic sections and quadratic curves.

questions.question: Which conic section has eccentricity equal to 1?
The general equation ax² + bxy + cy² + dx + ey + f = 0 represents:
questions.explanation: The general quadratic equation represents a conic section (ellipse, parabola, or hyperbola).

questions.question: For an ellipse, the eccentricity satisfies:
The discriminant b² - 4ac = 0 indicates:
questions.explanation: When the discriminant is zero, the conic is a parabola.

questions.question: Which property defines a parabola?
options: Sum of distances to foci is constant
Difference of distances to foci is constant
Distance to focus equals distance to directrix
All points are equidistant from center
questions.explanation: A parabola is defined as the set of points where distance to focus equals distance to directrix.
